page.title: 08WITTON PARK - SOCIAL HISTORY
page.content: In 1816 Witton park did not exist except a few houses in California Woodside. Then two men, Bolchow and Vaughan, built four blastfurnaces near George Pit. This was the beginning of the village and many new houses were built. These were small, one-up and one-down, and often damp, sharing outside ash closets and water supply. In 1856 the population was 2000 and in 1897, 4500 with 14 public houses, 27 shops and 10 places of worship. In 1882 the ironworks closed down, many people moved to Middlesborough and Depression followed. With the 2nd World War and the closing of pits many houses became derelict and were pulled down. In 1951 it was classed as Cat. D where there could be no further development. By 1980 the population was 505. Cat. D was lifted, houses modernised and it is again developing.
